availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Paul A. Blackwell (Henderson co, KY, police judge, merchant, farmer & banker)

body.p: Henderson County, Kentucky, farmer, banker, merchant, and police judge. Virginia native. Married to Martha S. Jones Blackwell. Father of William W. Blackwell, Mary Blackwell, Emma Blackwell, Ada Blackwell, and Alva Blackwell. Farmer in Henderson County, Kentucky, in 1850. Banker in Henderson County in 1860. Police judge in Henderson in 1861. Merchant in Henderson County in 1863.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Henderson County, Division 2, p. 315A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Henderson County, Division 1, p. 28.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Henderson County, Henderson Ward 4, p. 148A.
Consolidated Lists of Civil War Draft Registration Records Records of the Provost Marshal General's Bureau (Civil War) NARA RG 110, Henderson County, KY, July 1863, p. 3.
"Paul A. Blackwell (1826-1910)," Find A Grave, Memorial #95043160, accessed June 14, 2016, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/95043160/.
KYR-0001-017-0159.
